text.0:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Twitter account using the name and image of Kenya’s Education cabinet secretary claiming national exams will take place as scheduled in March 2021 despite the Covid-19 pandemic is fake.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: Prof Magoha does not have an official Twitter account: https://t.co/jj3RRlyOFS
text.1:
An article claiming that Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala has been confirmed as the new director-general of @wto is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: While Ms Okonjo-Iweala is a frontrunner for the position, a decision will be made at the General Council meeting on November 9, 2020: https://t.co/hDUZY6WcYY
text.2:
A Facebook post showing images of a critically wounded man lying in the street with a claim that he was shot by police in Uganda is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The documented incident happened during a protest in Nigeria: https://t.co/iDTckQMK7S
text.3:
A photo claiming to show Kenya's former prime minister Raila Odinga being chased by an angry mob on October 30, 2020, is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:camera_with_flash: The photo is of police firing tear gas at Mr Odinga’s motorcade when he returned from the US in November 2017: https://t.co/ggGLxJGxsb
text.4:
Do 7 Kenyan women die from breast cancer every day?

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: Data shows that breast cancer is the most frequent cancer among women in Kenya, with approximately 2,553 deaths annually: https://t.co/ZhGmZAz3EZ
